air are all but silenced." The show has experienced year-to-year declines of about 10 percent for the last several seasons now, so everyone expected ratings to drop," a TV insider tells me. The only question was how much they drop. And although the show did drop, it still produced huge numbers easily beating all its competition. Last week's episode was actually up from last Thursday's episode by nearly 18 percent, and was down only 9 percent from the equivalent episode last year. But after American Idol's smash third season, Fuller sued Simon Cowell , alleging that he had ripped off the Idol format by starting the British version of The X Factor. The battle between Fuller and Simon Cowell that played out in the British courts-this was the undercurrent of everything that went on from the beginning of Sitting in his grand but subdued corner-office suite at the headquarters of Sony Music UK, Simon Cowell spoke about the rift that eventually broke up one of the most successful partnerships in entertainment history." I didn't steal anything. I just made a new show as he made new shows, Simon Cowell said while sipping ginger tea and dragging on Kool cigarettes." Howard Stern made a shocking allegation while appearing on the Late Show with David Letterman . Howard Stern told David Letterman and the Late Show viewers that Regis Philbin didn't really retire, he was fired. He got fired. He went in and he asked for more money and they gave poor old Regis Philbin the boot, said Howard Stern ." I don't want to hear that. I don't want to believe that," said David Letterman .
